intro: Trichoscypha liketensis, commonly known as the Liketensia baobab, is a unique species of the Malvaceae family native to Central Africa. It is characterized by its massive, buttressed trunk and a canopy of broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Trichoscypha liketensis is adapted to seasonal climates and plays a vital role in its ecosystem as a habitat and food source. Its slow growth and longevity make it a significant component of the region's biodiversity.
